subject: Re: [junit] JUnit FAQ
msgSnippet: ... Thanks for the warm introduction, Erik! I ll be consolidating the JGuru FAQ with the FAQ distributed with JUnit and the mini-FAQ sent to new members of
messageBody:
geektank wrote:

> More exciting news on the JUnit front. The JUnit FAQ is moving to
> JGuru http://www.jguru.com/faq/JUnit and long time JUnit community
> member Mike Clark has accepted the position of FAQ Manager. For
> those of you not familiar with JGuru FAQs they allow people to submit
> and answer questions, similar to a FAQ-o-matic.
>
> I hope everyone will join me in welcoming Mike Clark aboard.
>

Thanks for the warm introduction, Erik!

I'll be consolidating the JGuru FAQ with the FAQ distributed with JUnit and
the mini-FAQ sent to new members of this list. As new and recurring
questions are asked on this list and the JGuru forum, they'll be added to the
FAQs.

This is truly a community effort and your contribution is greatly
appreciated. You're all gurus! When a new question is asked and answered by
anyone in the JGuru forum, a new FAQ will emerge. Questions asked and
answered on this list will also make their way to the FAQs, although by a
less-automated route.

So, if there's a question you'd like to see added to the FAQ, please ask (and
answer!).

Enjoy! ;-)

Mike

--
Mike Clark
Clarkware Consulting, Inc.
http://www.clarkware.com
720.851.2014
